div.div:
Initialize HTTP context
Accepts the connection and initialize all modules related to the request.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 228px; height: 1px; padding-top: 177px; margin-left: 322px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Determines the connection host
Tries to match the listening host with the incoming request host header if more than one listening host is being used.
- Uses the X-Forwarded-Host header if ResolveForwardedOriginHost is true.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 358px; height: 1px; padding-top: 70px; margin-left: 202px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;

Checks for body semantics
Checks if the request is sending body on non-semantic-methods if the ThrowContentOnNonSemanticMethods is enabled.

div.div:
Checks whether the Http response is null or abort
If an empty http response is returned, the connection will close with an ConnectionClosed state.
If an HttpRequest.Close state is returned, the connection is immediately closed.

switch.text: Checks whether the Http response is nu...

div.div:
Sends headers, status and content
If the response content wasn't sent yet by another location, such as websocket, sse or stream, send it in this step.
